networkFlow

Class NetworkGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • networkFlow.NetworkGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph

    public class NetworkGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    Network graph is a specially designed undirected graph to specifically demonstrate a Network Flow problem
    Since:
    2017-05-17
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addEdge(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest)
      Calls alternate addEdge function with a capacity of 0
      boolean addEdge(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest, int capacity)
      Adds an edge given the source and destination nodes and capacity
      void addFlow(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest, int units)
      Adds units of flow to an edge given a source and destination The units of flow is subtracted from the edge's capacity
      boolean addNode(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a node given the name
      void display(boolean displayCapacity)
      Displays the graphs adjacency list with/without the cost based on the boolean value of 'displayCosts'
      void displayGraphVis(boolean displayCapacity, java.lang.String fileName)
      Generates a graphvis generated pdf file
      java.lang.Integer find(Node src, Node dest, int maxCapac)
      Finds a path given a source and dest node uses DFS Adds nodes to NetworkGraph's Stack path to create path While finding path, also keeps track of bottleneck and returns value
      int fulkerson(java.lang.String startNode, java.lang.String dstNode)
      Performs Ford Fulkerson max flow algorithm on the graph given a start node and dest node
      Node getNode(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a node given the name
      java.util.Stack<Node> hasPath(Node start, Node dest)
      Given a start node and dest node, hasPath calls find() which uses DFS to determine if there is a path from src to dest.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void readGraph(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads the graph given a filename String
      void removeEdge(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest)
      Removes an edge given the source and destination nodes
      void removeFlow(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest, int units)
      Removes units of flow from an edge given a source and destination The units of flow will be added to the edge's capacity

      Removes a node given the name

      Resets all the nodes boolean visited property to false

      • removeFlow

        public void removeFlow(java.lang.String src,
                       java.lang.String dest,
                       int units)
        Removes units of flow from an edge given a source and destination The units of flow will be added to the edge's capacity

        dest - node
        units - of flow to remove from edge

      • find

        public java.lang.Integer find(Node src,
                              Node dest,
                              int maxCapac)
        Finds a path given a source and dest node uses DFS Adds nodes to NetworkGraph's Stack path to create path While finding path, also keeps track of bottleneck and returns value
        Parameters:
        src - node
        dest - node
        maxCapac - current max capacity to keep track of bottleneck
        Returns:
        bottleneck of path or null

      • hasPath

        public java.util.Stack<Node> hasPath(Node start,
                                     Node dest)
        Given a start node and dest node, hasPath calls find() which uses DFS to determine if there is a path from src to dest. Returns a stack of the path or null
        Parameters:
        start - node
        dest - node
        Returns:
        Stack path or null

        Parameters:
        startNode -
        dstNode -
        Returns:
        max flow
